description:
goprotobuf: Introduce new proto.Message type.

Every generated protocol buffer type now implements the proto.Message interface,
which means we can add some compile-time type safety throughout the API
as well as drop a bunch of error cases.

messages.text:
Hello r (cc: golang-dev@googlegroups.com),

I'd like you to review this change to
https://code.google.com/p/goprotobuf

On Thu, Jun 14, 2012 at 3:45 AM, Russ Cox <rsc@golang.org> wrote:

> Are there any parts that differ from the internal version and would
> merit closer scrutiny?

No, this is a boring automated export.

LGTM

Are there any parts that differ from the internal version and would
merit closer scrutiny?

Russ

*** Submitted as http://code.google.com/p/goprotobuf/source/detail?r=6a3d154261b5 ***

goprotobuf: Introduce new proto.Message type.

Every generated protocol buffer type now implements the proto.Message interface,
which means we can add some compile-time type safety throughout the API
as well as drop a bunch of error cases.

R=r, rsc
CC=golang-dev
http://codereview.appspot.com/6298073

subject: code review 6298073: goprotobuf: Introduce new proto.Message type.
